fs.gui
Class EditCloseTabComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  fs.gui.TabComponent
                      fs.gui.EditCloseTabComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceDependent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class EditCloseTabComponent
extends TabComponent
implements ResourceDependent

This is a more concrete implementation of TabComponent. It builds a TabComponent that (optionally) already contains:
- A JLabel that can change into an editable text field on double click for changing the label's text.
- An iconified JButton (The appearance can be changed), that takes the form of a close button. Automatic removal of the associated tab can be (de)activated.
Both components can be accessed and messed around with freely (i.e.: they can be obtained via public methods), all internal methods are written in a robust way, so no exceptions will be caused by possible changes (e.g. one component is set to null). However, unexpected behavior is of course possible. Without any external changes, the standard behavior is the following: The label changes into a text field, when double-clicked. It contains the original label text, completely selected and has requested keyboard focus. When the user presses ENTER, the text field changes back into the label, which contains the new text. When the user presses ESCAPE, it changes back to the label with the original text. Focus loss or arbitrary mouse clicks do not cause the label to reappear. Any of these have to implemented manually.

The component can notify potential listeners about changes by firing PropertyChangeEvents for the following events:
- Mode has changed (Property name: 'mode', value: 'edit' or 'display')
- Text editing has been terminated, by confirmation or abortion (Property name: 'text', value: original and new text. If both values are identical, null and new text are sent)

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

EditCloseTabComponent

public EditCloseTabComponent(java.lang.String title)
Creates a standard tab component that contains a label bearing the specified title and an activated close button represented by an icon.
A component created by this constructor will by default NOT forward any mouse clicks to the main panel or to any JTabbedPane
All necessary graphical resources will be loaded from the default resource path. If this is not the correct path, you should use a different constructor

EditCloseTabComponent

public EditCloseTabComponent(java.lang.String title,
                             javax.swing.JTabbedPane associatedPane,
                             boolean replaceLabelOnDblClick,
                             boolean displayCloseButton,
                             ResourceReference r)
Initializes an EditCloseTabComponent with the specified properties:

Parameters:
title - The title displayed by the label
associatedPane - The JTabbedPane in which this component will serve as tab component
replaceLabelOnDblClick - Indicates whether the label should change into a text field on double click for title editing
displayCloseButton - Indicates whether the close button should be displayed
r - The resource reference for locating the icon for the button (if this null, the default location will be used).
Method Detail

isReplaceLabelOnDblClick

public boolean isReplaceLabelOnDblClick()
Returns:
If the label is replaced by a text field for editing on double click

isCloseButtonActive

public boolean isCloseButtonActive()
Returns:
Whether the close button is active, i.e. closes the tab

setReplaceLabelOnDblClick

public void setReplaceLabelOnDblClick(boolean replaceLabelOnDblClick)
Sets if the label should be replaced by a text field for editing on double click

setToDisplayMode

public void setToDisplayMode()
Hides the text field (if visible) and displays the label. Call is ignored if text field is already invisible and label already visible

displayChanges

public void displayChanges()
If the component is in edit mode, it changes the label's text into the current text of the text field and calls EditCloseTabComponent.setToDisplayMode(). If the component is in display mode, this call is ignored

setToEditMode

public void setToEditMode()
Hides the label (if visible) and activates the text field. The text field will react as usual, i.e. disappear when the user presses ESCAPE/ENTER, etc. If the TextField is already visible when this method is called, the call is ignored

setCloseButtonVisibility

public void setCloseButtonVisibility(boolean visible)
Sets the visibility of the close button and repaints the component

activateCloseButton

public void activateCloseButton(boolean active)
Activates or deactivates the close button. If it is active then on click the application will try to remove the associated tab from its JTabbedPane. This will not change visibility

activateEditor

public void activateEditor(boolean active)
Activates or deactivates the text field. If the text field is visible while this method deactivates it, this will have the same effect, as if editing was aborted

closeTab

public void closeTab()
Tries to remove the associated tab (if any) from its JTabbedPane

getCloseButton

public javax.swing.JButton getCloseButton()
Returns:
the close button

getTextEditor

public javax.swing.JTextField getTextEditor()
Returns:
the text field for editing the tab's name

getTextLabel

public javax.swing.JLabel getTextLabel()
Returns:
the text label for displaying the tab's name

setCloseButton

public void setCloseButton(javax.swing.JButton closeButton)
Replaces the close button. The new button will be placed at the last index of the component.

setTextEditor

public void setTextEditor(javax.swing.JTextField textEditor)
Replaces the text field used to edit the tab's title. The new text field will be placed at the first index.

setTextLabel

public void setTextLabel(javax.swing.JLabel textLabel)
Replaces the label used to display the tab's title. The label will be set at the second index

assignReference

public void assignReference(ResourceReference r)
Assigns a resource reference for locating the image file necessary for the close icon. If null, the default path is used. The icon will be reloaded afterwards and the component repainted

Specified by:
assignReference in interface ResourceDependent
See Also:
ResourceDependent.assignReference(fs.xml.ResourceReference)

getExpectedResourceStructure

public org.dom4j.Document getExpectedResourceStructure()
The only resource needed is "(base directory)/graphics/EditCloseTabComponent/close.png"
